description: This object is used to provision the administrative OAM mode for this interface.
The dot3OamAdminState always starts in the disabled(2) state
until an explicit management action or configuration
information retained by the system causes a transition to the
enabled(1) state. When enabled(1), Ethernet OAM will attempt
EFM-OAM can become operational only for a port with a VLAN assignment for untagged traffic.
That means the related bridgeport must be untagged member in a VLAN.
As long as this requirement is not fulfilled, the operstate will
be stand in state 'disabled' even if the adminstate was set to 'enabled'.
variables.name: SHE-OAM-MIB::sheDot3OamTableControlAdminState

$SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-OAM-MIB::sheCfmOamMepStatusChanged SHE-OAM-MIB::sheCfmMepOperState i 2 SHE-OAM-MIB::sheCfmMepDefectConditions b 0 SHE-OAM-MIB::sheCfmMepConnectivityStatus i 0 SHE-OAM-MIB::sheCfmMepRdiTransmitStatus i 1

description: Current operational state of the MEP
Up indicates that the MP is to function normally, and down that it has ceased functioning.
variables.name: SHE-OAM-MIB::sheCfmMepOperState

description: The current defect conditions of the MEP.
Alarm defects according IEEE 802.1ag could be found in sheCfmMepEthDefects parameter.
Y.1731 defect conditions map to IEEE 802.1ag defects
signalFail(5) # bDefXconCCM(4) or bDefErrorCCM(3) or bDefRemoteCCM(2)
variables.name: SHE-OAM-MIB::sheCfmMepDefectConditions

description: The current connectivity status for the MEP within the MA/MEG.
'fullConnectivity' indicates that the MEP is able to exchange CCMs
with all known remote MEPs within the MA/MEG.
'partialConnectivity' indicates that the MEP is able to exchange
CCMs with at least one but not all known remote MEPs within the MA/MEG.
'noConnectivity' indicates that the MEP is unable to exchange CCMs with
any of the known remote MEPs within the MA/MEG.
'unknown' indicates that the MEP is not actively exchanging CCMs
with its remote MEPs within the MA/MEG, either because no remote MEPs are
defined, ETH-CC is not active or the MEP is disabled.
NOTE: 'partialConnectivity' is not supported by NE.
variables.name: SHE-OAM-MIB::sheCfmMepConnectivityStatus

description: Indicates whether the MEP is generating a Remote Defect Indicator (RDI) bit in the CCM frames that it is transmitting.

description: The type/format of this object is determined by the value of the sheCfmMaMegNetIdFormat object.
If sheCfmMaMegNetY1731Compliant = false, this value defines the Short Maintenance Association name, which MUST be unique within the maintenance domain.
If sheCfmMaMegNetY1731Compliant = true, this value defines the MEG ID, which MUST be globally unique
variables.name: SHE-OAM-MIB::sheCfmMaMegNetIdValue

description: To identify whether this entry in the sheCfmMaMegNetEntry represents an IEEE 802.1ag compliant
MA (false) or an ITU-T Y.1731 compliant MEG (true).
- the MAID is provisioned in the CCM frames from the MD name (sheCfmMdFormat, sheCfmMdName)
- MD Level is provisioned in the CCM frames from sheCfmMdLevel
- the Maintenance Domain Name in CCM frames is null as required by Y.1731, i.e., MD Name
Format in the CCM frame is set to none(1)
- the MEGID is provisioned in the CCM frames based on sheCfmMaMegNetIdFormat and
- ME Level (MEL) is provisioned in the CCM frames from sheCfmMaMegNetLevel
- NE only supports Y.1731 and thus the value is always 'true'.
- To configure a 802.1ag compatible CCM MAID field format, where the Maintenance Domain is not
present, set sheCfmMaMegNetIdFormat to the Short MA Name Format and sheCfmMaMegNetIdValue
